page.title: 14PRESTON VILLAGE
page.content: In Domesday times,Preston was linked with the manor of Temple Dinsley.Its earliest name was Wedelee and the first reference to 'Preston' was made at the time of the Knights Templar.It grew from a small hamlet,until in 1894 an old map shows it as a complete village with its own church_school, a miller,butcher,tailor,wheelwright,car_ penter,carter,bakehouse,2 shops and several farms.The traders have gone but the farms and 1 shop remain.The village now has a separate church and school and a pub.There is also a girls independent boarding school.The resi_ dents commute to London and the nearby towns to work as Preston is purely a residential village. There are many attractive houses and the setting is quiet and picturesque.
